title: Lawmakers remove ‘revenge’ tax provision from Trump's big bill after Treasury Department request

Supreme Court curbs judges' power to block Trump's orders in birthright citizenship case
description: Because of the ruling to limit injunctions, Trump's birthright citizenship order will be able to take effect, 30 days after the courts opinion was filed, the court said.

title: Supreme Court ruling expands Trump's power - and he intends to use it
description: The US' top court limited the ability of judges to issue nationwide injunctions, making it easier for Trump to carry out his agenda through executive orders.

title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil

description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

title: Trump ends all U.S. trade talks with Canada over digital services tax
description: Trump's announcement on Truth Social accused Canada of "copying the European Union" with the "egregious" tax.

title: Germany tells Apple, Google to block DeepSeek as the Chinese AI app faces rising pressure in Europe
description: This is not DeepSeek's first run-in with regulators in Europe, following run-ins with Italian and Irish authorities.

title: Trump Calls Being President A "Very Dangerous Profession"
description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday reflected on threats to his life as he celebrated a court ruling that handed his administration sweeping power to pursue his policy agenda.

title: Trump Must Stop "Disrespectful" Tone Against Khamenei if He Wants Deal: Iran
description: Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi condemned Saturday the "disrespectful and unacceptable" comments from US President Donald Trump, who claimed to have saved Iran's supreme leader Ali Khamenei from an "ugly and ignominious death".

title: Fate of Iran’s Enriched Uranium Is a Mystery
description: U.S. intelligence agencies had long assessed that, faced with the possibility of an attack on its nuclear facilities, Iran would try to move its stockpile.
author: Julian E. Barnes and David E. Sanger

title: Russia Seizes Key Lithium Field in Challenge for U.S.-Ukraine Minerals Deal
description: The capture highlights a core problem in the agreement: The more territory Moscow grabs, the fewer resources Kyiv can offer to Washington.

title: US journalist arrested and charged with possessing child sex abuse material
description: Thomas LeGro, a Washington Post journalist, faces charges after being arrested for allegedly possessing child pornography. The Department of Justice revealed that 11 videos depicting child sexual abuse material were discovered on LeGro's work laptop during a search of his residence. The case is part of Project Safe Childhood, a DoJ initiative to combat online child exploitation.
author: TOI World Desk

title: Trump eyes mineral wealth as Rwanda and DRC sign controversial peace deal in US
description: Agreement aims to end decades-old conflict rooted in the 1994 Rwandan genocide but critics have described it as vague and opaqueRwanda and the Democratic Republic of the Congo have signed a peace deal in Washington to end fighting in eastern DRC, although questions remain over what the agreement means and who stands to benefit – with Donald Trump using the occasion to boast that the US had secured lucrative mineral rights.At a ceremony with US secretary of state Marco Rubio in Washington, the two African countries’ foreign ministers signed the agreement pledging to implement a 2024 deal that would see Rwandan troops withdraw from eastern Congo within 90 days. Continue reading...
author: Carlos Mureithi in Nairobi and agencies

title: Rising poverty in conflict zones ‘causes a billion people to go hungry’
description: In first assessment since pandemic in 2020, World Bank urges other countries to step up supportExtreme poverty is accelerating in 39 countries affected by war and conflict, leaving more than a billion people to go hungry, according to the World Bank.Civil wars and confrontations between nations, mostly in Africa, have set back economic growth and reduced the incomes of more than a billion people, “driving up extreme poverty faster than anywhere else”, the Washington-based body said. Continue reading...
author: Phillip Inman

title: Small bear disrupts Japanese airport, prompting low-speed chase on runway
description: Twelve flights were canceled Thursday as airport employees chased the bear around the runway, an airport official said. The runway reopened later that night.
author: Angie Orellana Hernandez

title: What is birthright citizenship, and which countries have it?
description: President Donald Trump has falsely claimed the U.S. is alone in offering citizenship as a birthright. More than 30 countries do — but some have rolled it back.
author: Vivian Ho
